overview: On June 14, 1973, the House of Dafne Larrosa in Uruguay, was raided by the military of the dictatorship. She and the members of her family linked to the Tupamaro National Liberation Movement, were arrested and her brother assassinated. Dafne manages to escape to Cuba, where she recieves political asylum. After more than thirty years of exile, Dafne returns to Uruguay. Returning to the house was like a tunnel of time were childhood and old age, the living and the dead, reality and creation coexist at the same time.
title: The Flooded House
